did.unittitle: Vincent Tilyou, Mary Tilyou, and Richard Doty deed
did.abstract: An 1814 deed for property in New York City owned by the deceased Vincent Tilyou and his widow Mary Tilyou and sold to Richard Doty.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Mrs. D. Irving Mead, 1957.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection consists of a single document.

prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Vincent Tilyou, Mary Tilyou, and Richard Doty deed, 1977.496, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2023.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Deed for property in New York City owned by the deceased Vincent Tilyou, a chain maker, and his widow Mary Tilyou, and sold to Richard Doty, a brewer. The deed is administered by John Tilyou and John Connors, executors of Vincent Tilyou's will, and is dated May 2, 1814.
